column1: That's the interview what was your second topic for scenarios?
School? Amazing. Okay So what did you think about the use of VR in the stories and what part of the stories stood out for you?
Why did you like the museum one specifically?
It was good to see.... anywhere you can go
Definitely, what kind of problems do you think VR might create for you?
Some kids might be addicted to it and be on it every day
Who do you think decide which VR experiences are a good choice for children?
Parents? anyone else?, teachers, lawmakers, scientists?
When VR makers are creating these VR experiences, what do you think they should keep in mind specifically for children?
Umm. they might use it for...
No worries! Is there anything else you want to share about your experience? Any of the stories that you thought were.... just anything? no?
